title: Overtourism has killed one of Amsterdam's finest attractions – here's where to go instead
text:
Tulips from Amsterdam growing in your own back garden: what could be a more pleasant, lasting and apt souvenir of your visit to the Dutch capital or the bulb fields? Or so you thought. A recent survey shows that just 1% of the bulbs bought from the city’s tourist spots ever come into bloom.

The survey, carried out for the Dutch Royal General Bulb Growers’ Association (KAVB) together with city authorities, involved the planting and tender care of bulbs bought at Amsterdam’s Flower Market and at the ‘Bulb Boulevard’ beside the main road at nearby Lisse, site of the famed Keukenhof Gardens in the heart of the bulb fields. Of the 1,364 bulbs purchased in Amsterdam, a paltry 14 struggled into flower. That’s a petal more than 1%. Lisse hardly scored better, with 2%.
